newsitem.title: USA: Construction underway on Calif. Pacific Pipeline. [CORRECTED 00:56 GMT 5/9]
newsitem.headline: Construction underway on Calif. Pacific Pipeline. [CORRECTED 00:56 GMT 5/9]

text.p: Pacific Pipeline said on Tuesday construction is underway on a 132-mile pipeline which will carry heavy grade crudes from California's central valley to Los Angeles refineries by mid-1997.
"The line is being laid now," said pipeline spokesman Jim Shamas.
Chevron Corp, and Texaco Inc are partners in the proposed 130,000 barrel per day line.
(Corrects to remove reference to Unocal Corp).
The companies now bring crude oil to their L.A. plants via trucks, trains and ships because of limited pipeline space.
Part of the line will run through Angeles National Forest, which approved construction of the line on their lands last March.
And in April, the California Public Utilities Commission also gave the go-ahead.
